intro: Descurainia antarctica var. bonarellii, commonly known as the Antarctic bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern regions of South America. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are characteristic of the Brassicaceae family. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a bluish-green hue. The species is adapted to harsh environments, showcasing resilience to cold and arid conditions.
